title: Attacks of opportunity
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

> When you move away from an enemy, they have a small (1/3) chance of taking advantage and launching a free attack. Repositioning and retreating is often still good, but keep an eye out for those extra attacks.

**Attacks of opportunity** (**AOO**, **AOOp**) can trigger whenever you move away from an enemy in melee.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
  - [1.1 Avoiding](#Avoiding)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Whenever you move away from an enemy's melee attack range, and the monster would pursue, it has a 33% chance to trigger an attack of opportunity. This allows it to move and attack simultaneously. They can only occur if a monster would choose to pursue. Enemies with [reaching](/Reaching "Reaching") attacks can make attacks of opportunity from 2 tiles away. Even if you are faster than the opponent, attacks of opportunity can still be made.

The time spent for this combined move is a single monster turn, but with a 50% chance for it to lose an extra 10% of a turn. If a monster attacks slower than it moves, or moves slower than the attacks, it takes time equal to the slower of the two actions.

Note that [random energy](/Random_energy "Random energy") does not apply whenever an attack of opportunity happens. However, if a monster would be eligible for an attack, but doesn't actually get one, random energy will apply.

### Avoiding

The following conditions will prevent attacks of opportunity entirely:

- If a monster would choose not to move or melee attack, it won't make attacks of opportunity. For example, a [centaur](/Centaur_\(monster\) "Centaur (monster)") will prefer to use its bow over a weak melee attack.

- Monsters who cannot move or melee attack will not perform attacks of opportunity, so the following statuses stop them entirely:

  - Incapacitation: [Asleep](/Asleep "Asleep"), [paralysed](/Paralysed "Paralysed"), [petrified](/Petrified "Petrified"), or [confused](/Confused "Confused")
  - Cannot move: [Constricted](/Constrict "Constrict"), caught in a [web](/Web "Web")/[net](/Net "Net")
  - Cannot attack: [Fleeing](/Fear "Fear")
  - Cannot see you: you are [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") to the attacker or the attacker is [blinded](/Blind "Blind")

- If you swap places with an [ally](/Ally "Ally"), so that the ally blocks the monster's movement, you avoid an attack of opportunity.

- [Zin](/Zin "Zin")'s Sanctuary prevents all attacks. This protection is retroactive - if you were previously outside the area and moved inside, the Sanctuary still protects you.

- You become immune to attacks of opportunity while performing [martial attacks](/Wu_Jian "Wu Jian"), [rampaging](/Rampaging "Rampaging"), or Serpent's Lash.

- [Translocations](/Translocation "Translocation") don't count as movement, so you can use them safely.

Being faster than the monster can help you escape from a melee monster, but attacks of opportunity can still occur. For example, against a 100% speed monster, a [hasted](/Haste "Haste") player can take at most 2 attacks of opportunity before escaping melee range.

## Strategy

Watch out! When retreating, a 100% speed enemy with AOO gets more attacks than an [adder](/Adder "Adder") would without AOO. Always try to reposition (say, to a [upstairs](/Stair_dancing "Stair dancing")) *before* you get adjacent to them.

Should you need to retreat from a bad fight, your options are limited. Common ways to escape include:

- Swapping places with a [summon](/Summon "Summon") or other type of [ally](/Ally "Ally")
- Prevent the monster from moving: [Throwing net](/Throwing_net "Throwing net"), [BVC](/BVC "BVC"), [wand of roots](/Wand_of_roots "Wand of roots")
- Translocating yourself away: [Blink](/Blink "Blink"), [Passage of Golubria](/Passage_of_Golubria "Passage of Golubria"), [scroll of teleport](/Scroll_of_teleport "Scroll of teleport"), [scroll of blinking](/Scroll_of_blinking "Scroll of blinking")
- Sending the monster away: [Iskenderun's Mystic Blast](/Iskenderun%27s_Mystic_Blast "Iskenderun's Mystic Blast"), [Dispersal](/Dispersal "Dispersal") ([spell](/Dispersal "Dispersal") and [darts](/Dispersal_\(brand\) "Dispersal (brand)")), [scroll of butterflies](/Scroll_of_butterflies "Scroll of butterflies"), [phial of floods](/Phial_of_floods "Phial of floods")

## History

- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), attacks of opportunity were reworked. Prior to this version:

  - Monsters didn't have a 50% chance to lose 0.1 of a turn after making an opportunity attack.
  - Monsters only made attacks of opportunity if you were *adjacent*, not in *melee range*. Therefore, monsters with [reaching](/Reaching "Reaching") attacks couldn't make attacks of opportunity. Their AI would let you get 2 tiles away before chasing, thus invalidating opportunity attacks.
  - You were immune to attacks of opportunity if you moved faster than the monster.
  - Certain [attack flavours](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"), such as [engulf](/Engulf "Engulf"), [constrict](/Constrict "Constrict"), and any effect that moved the player or monster, were disabled during attacks of opportunity.

* Also, [random energy](/Random_energy "Random energy") was re-introduced in this version.

- Attacks of opportunity were introduced in [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), as a replacement for [energy randomisation](/Energy_randomisation "Energy randomisation").

Contents

    • 1.1 Avoiding
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History

Useful Info

  • Monsters who cannot move or melee attack will not perform attacks of opportunity, so the following statuses stop them entirely:
    • Incapacitation: Asleep, paralysed, petrified, or confused
    • Cannot move: Constricted, caught in a web/net
    • Cannot attack: Fleeing
    • Cannot see you: you are invisible to the attacker or the attacker is blinded
  • If you swap places with an ally, so that the ally blocks the monster's movement, you avoid an attack of opportunity.
  • Zin's Sanctuary prevents all attacks. This protection is retroactive - if you were previously outside the area and moved inside, the Sanctuary still protects you.
  • You become immune to attacks of opportunity while performing martial attacks, rampaging, or Serpent's Lash.

  • Swapping places with a summon or other type of ally
  • Prevent the monster from moving: Throwing net, BVC, wand of roots
  • Translocating yourself away: Blink, Passage of Golubria, scroll of teleport, scroll of blinking
  • Sending the monster away: Iskenderun's Mystic Blast, Dispersal (spell and darts), scroll of butterflies, phial of floods

History

  • In 0.31, attacks of opportunity were reworked. Prior to this version:
    • Monsters didn't have a 50% chance to lose 0.1 of a turn after making an opportunity attack.
    • Monsters only made attacks of opportunity if you were adjacent, not in melee range. Therefore, monsters with reaching attacks couldn't make attacks of opportunity. Their AI would let you get 2 tiles away before chasing, thus invalidating opportunity attacks.
    • You were immune to attacks of opportunity if you moved faster than the monster.
    • Certain attack flavours, such as engulf, constrict, and any effect that moved the player or monster, were disabled during attacks of opportunity.
Also, random energy was re-introduced in this version.
  • Attacks of opportunity were introduced in 0.29, as a replacement for energy randomisation.
